original_text: Title: The recent struggles of top AI stocks show investors are realizing they were 'sold a bill of goods,' AI scientist says. Description: AI scientist Gary Marcus thinks the underwhelming release of ChatGPT-5 marked a turning point when investors realized AI might not be a game changer.. URL: https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-stock-crash-ai-chatgpt5-gary-marcus-nvda-orcl-crwv-2026-2
ai_article:
In a recent revelation, AI scientist Gary Marcus has suggested that investors may have been misled about the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) stocks. The lackluster debut of ChatGPT-5 seems to have been a wake-up call for many, signaling that AI may not be the groundbreaking technology it was once believed to be.

This news has had a significant impact on top AI stocks, with companies like NVIDIA (NVDA), Oracle (ORCL), and CrowdStrike (CRWD) experiencing struggles in the market. As investors begin to question the true value of AI technology, these stocks have taken a hit.

Marcus believes that the hype surrounding AI may have led investors to overlook some of the limitations and challenges that come with the technology. As a result, the recent performance of AI stocks has left many feeling disillusioned.

To learn more about the implications of this revelation and how it could impact the future of AI stocks, check out the full article at: https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-stock-crash-ai-chatgpt5-gary-marcus-nvda-orcl-crwv-2026-2
